name: Hanover Marriott

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights feb 24 & 25. Very nice room. Very crowded parking lot. The restaurant had very little for children,but we found a Diner (Brookside Diner) about 10 mins away.The food was great with a very large menu. Right out of the hotel on rt 10 E. The hotel had a great pool so we were happy. Would come back.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: This recently remodeled hotel has great amenities for both working and relaxing. The staff are attentive and very personable. The food is great and the waitstaff helpful. And if you can take advantage of the concierge suite, you won't be disappointed. I stay here weekly and wouldn't change a thing.
reviews.title: Great Place to Work and Relax

reviews.text: The entire staff of this hotel went out of their way to be pleasant and helpful. Everyone that greeted me had a smile on their face and expressed their appreciation for my stay. The rooms were spacious and very clean, as was the entire hotel. I found the food very good. The bedding and pillows were extremely comfortable and the restroom was well lit. (something I struggle with in most hotels)
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Hanover Marriott on a number of occasions. The last visit was in the midst of a signficant renovation, thus it was a bit messy and inconvenient. However, the renovation is now complete and it's turned this property into a very attractive hotel. The lobby is friendly and inviting and some of the finished touchs, like the frosted glass counters at check-in are very modern and attractive. The rooms are the typically well appointed Marriott rooms and the staff is friendly and accommodating The restaurant serving the buffet breakfast provided a typical, but very tasty seletion of breakfast items. All in all, a nice place to stay and do business. It's now a more luxurious location with the renovation.
reviews.title: Very nice renovation!

reviews.text: I would've given this Marriott 3.5 stars if I could have. It gives off a very hip vibe without being uncomfortable, and I definitely appreciated that.
reviews.title: Above average business hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights in Dec 2011. GOOD: front desk staff is friendly and helpful, hotel and rooms are newly renovated BAD: located in the middle of no where (taxi ride to nearest mall costed me around $35 with tips one way), housekeeping needs to be improved (only 2 sheets of paper on the notepad when I first arrived, I used them but never got refilled on the 2nd or 3rd day of my stay, so as some other amenities), there is NO free wi-fi in guest rooms (only in lobby), there is no whirlpool and there are some black stuff at the bottom of the swimming pool.
reviews.title: A nice hotel but nothing within walking distance

reviews.text: I travel back and forth to NJ a lot for our company. We have a few hotels to choose from, but I prefer the Marriott. The staff will get to know your names and they really care about how your day is. The Irish Pub at the hotel offers a different flavor to the food menu. I live in the south and we don't have many Irish Pubs. The staff in the Concierge Lounge is very friendly and I enjoy stopping in at the end of the day or even for breakfast or to just say hi. The location along Route 10 is helpful also. Hotel has been upgraded over the last year and is brighter and very up to date. Wine Bar in lobby is good for people looking to unwind and just relax.
reviews.title: Feedback on Hanover Marriott

reviews.text: I travel WAY too much for work, and typically do not look forward to hotel nights, with one exception. I've come to consider the Hanover Marriott a true home away from home. The staff, from upper management on down, are all obviously concerned about, and interested in, the experience they provide their guests. I feel this hotel gets it....We road warriors begrudgingly schlep from city to city, and they go the extra mile to make "us" feel at home. I defy anyone to find a comparable hotel that does their job as well as this team does. Kudos to Rob, Michael, Matt, and all of the staff at The Hanover Marriott......
reviews.title: My undisputed home away from home.......

reviews.text: Having stayed many times at various Marriott hotels, we have come to expect quality service. This was not the case at this property. Nothing major -- but the minor things added up: checking into the room and finding an ancient scratched and chipped refrigerator: only one decaf coffee and insufficient creamer in the room and the staff in the hall unable to locate more for half an hour; the swimming pool becoming dark as evening came on and no lights put on; requesting the room be made up when we went to breakfast and finding it undone still at 1 PM -- and at that the shampoo and conditioner not replaced, the bed scarf not put on the bed. Furthermore the lobby and restaurant were freezing cold and when it was mentioned to the staff at the front desk they responded, "yes, it does tend to be cold." The final insult was to come home and find the charge on our credit card $50 higher than the amount we paid at check out. When called, the hotel responded that they put that extra on the bill in case there are other charges and they will refund it in a few days. All in all, not what the Marriott name would lead one to expect.
reviews.title: Indifferent and ungracious service

reviews.text: Stayed for a week on business. The hotel has undergone a complete renovation, they are finishing up the work out room at this time. Extremely comfortable and clean. Great staff, had a small issue that was cleared up imediately, and then I was greeted by name for the remainder of the stay. (How cool is that!)
reviews.title: Recently redone and done right!

reviews.text: Stayed here in December 2011; property is beautiful, rooms are gorgeous, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, except for the food

reviews.text: Breakfast offered in Seeds is terrible... buffet food looks and tastes like it's mass-cooked and left somewhere hot, until breakfast is over. Bacon is incredibly salty and low quality, eggs are obviously liquid bulk, cooked in hydrogenated oil and unseasoned. Omelet station not much better. After two days I went out to a local diner for breakfast.
reviews.title: Your expectations will be exceeded!

reviews.text: Auld Shebeen Irish pub atmosphere, staff and beverages are great, but not the food. Ate here 3 nights (dinner w/clients also staying in the hotel) before deciding to go out for dinner during remainder of stay. The hot dishes (stew, shepherd's pie) taste like TV dinners or out of a can. Soups have no flavor; onion soup is overpowered by too much dried thyme. Strip steak was bitter and had a mealy texture from marinade and sauce was obviously powdered with no meat flavor.
reviews.title: Return trip was just as good...

reviews.text: Overall, food at the hotel is not fresh and shows a lack of care in preparation. Menus seriously lack creativity or inventiveness. I don't often say things this frankly, but the chef in charge needs to do a much better job, or should be replaced with someone who's more food-focused.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Even Better Staff

reviews.text: I have been staying at the Hanover Marriott for over a year now. It has undergone a wonderful renovation last year and is quite an eye pleaser. The hotel is very clean, quiet, and the beds are the absolute best. You will not find a more greeting and helpful staff, from the front desk team - to the maintenance team - to the restaurant team, everyone will make you welcome during your stay. You can be assured that you will have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. If I were to even try to list all the names of the staff that have made my time away from home special, I would certainly run out of space. The folks that work there, truly enjoy there jobs and the opportunity to meet your needs.
reviews.title: Great job

reviews.text: I've been staying at this hotel for 12 years. Every time I return, I feel welcomed and appreciated.The front desk and the Shebeen staff are always friendly. The hotel is centrally located to restaurants and other activities. The new furnishings and amenities make this hotel first class, and the concierge lounge is one of the best in the Marriott system.
reviews.title: 2 Thumbs Up!

reviews.text: I've stayed at most of the surrounding hotels in the area, and this is by far the best!
reviews.title: Comfortable and Nicer than expected

reviews.text: We went to visit relatives and found this hotel to be a nice place to stay. We will definitely stay there again. It is nicer than most Marriotts in smaller places.
reviews.title: New Jersey was in a State of Emergency, but the Hotel kicked butt

reviews.text: We booked last minute because of a monster October snowstorm came through and wiped out power to 2.7 million area residents. The hotel booked up completely and then briefly lost power. We had our struggles with room service, but the hotel manager took the time to help me personally. I recognized how busy his entire hotel was and was impressed by the individual attention i received, and by the calmness with which the staff handled the chaos with the grumpy displaced occupants.
reviews.title: Who wouldn't love it? Clean, comfortable, quiet, lovely decor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about the Hanover Marriott. For starters, it's absolutely lovely to look at. All new, recent renovation, and spotlessly clean. Very high marks for whomever was in charge of the decor. The lobby is done in a very spacious and airy sort of Scandinavian style. Beautiful glass fixture----really too large to be a chandelier, it's more of an art installation which happens to have lights---on the ceiling as you walk in, and a smaller version near the check-in desk. tasteful, unadorned furniture, pretty and unusual paintings and sculptures throughout, big atrium, lots of natural light. The rooms are done in a vaguely Asian style with lots of attention to detail. Nothing here looks like standard-hotel-issue (raise your hand if you're sick of burgundy paisley), it looks like someone's house. Someone with good taste.Color scheme is pear green and dark walnut brown with a few touches of aubergine. (did I mention I was sick of burgundy colored patterns in hotel rooms? It makes me wonder what it's trying to camouflage!)The lamps, the mirror frames, the light fixtures, the wall art AND the frames they're in, even the taps and faucets are all very tasteful and pleasing to the eye. Beds and bedding very comfortable and brand-spankin'-new, and you get a whole pile of pillows to nest in. I found my room to be very clean, very quiet late at night, and when you turn on the heat, it makes only gentle white noise, not the jet-engine sounds you get at some hotels! We had several occasions to consult the front desk staff: how to get to nearest train station, where is there good shopping, etc and they were always friendly and helpful. We had drinks in the bar twice, very pleasant and cozy Irish style pub with lots of heavy wood and subtle low lighting. It's called Ye Olde Shebeen.(I had to look that up---shebeen is an unlicensed drinking establishment. I'm sure they're kidding.) and my travelling companion dubbed their bartender "best Cosmo maker ever". We had breakfast in the restaurant once, got the buffet for $16, everything fresh and tasty. Would definitely recommend this place to all. AND it's very reasonably priced! $129 was the regular rate, $123 for triple-A members.
reviews.title: Nice stay

description: A Hanover hotel in Whippany, New Jersey offering comfortable accommodations, wedding planning, meeting facilities, and vacation packages.
